comment: Sample: msg_id="3A00-0002" Virtual Router Redundancy Protocol (VRRP) is now enabled for this Active/Passive Cluster.
Description: VRRP is now enabled for Cluster.
Format: VRRP is now enabled for Cluster.

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Event Monitoring" name="VRRP enabled" description="VRRP is now enabled for Cluster."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3A00-0004" Virtual Router with cluster ID 1 started in master state.
Description: VRRP started in master state.
Format: Virtual Router with cluster ID %d started in master state.
Variables: Virtual Router with cluster ID ${value} started in master state.

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Event Monitoring" name="VRRP start master" description="VRRP started in master state."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3A00-0005" Virtual Router with cluster ID 1 returned to initial state.
Description: Virtual Router returned to initial state.
Format: Virtual Router with cluster ID %d returned to initial state.
Variables: Virtual Router with cluster ID ${id} returned to initial state

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Event Monitoring" name="VR shutdown" description="Virtual Router returned to initial state."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3A00-0006" Virtual Router with cluster ID 1 becomes backup on pause event
Description: Virtual Router becomes backup due to a pause event.
Format: Virtual Router with cluster ID %d becomes backup on pause event
Variables: Virtual Router with cluster ID ${id} becomes backup on pause event

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Event Monitoring" name="VR pause" description="Virtual Router becomes backup due to a pause event."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3A00-0007" Virtual Router with cluster ID 1 becomes master on resume event
Description: Virtual Router becomes master due to a resume event.
Format: Virtual Router with cluster ID %d becomes master on resume event
Variables: Virtual Router with cluster ID ${id} becomes master on resume event

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Event Monitoring" name="VR resume" description="Virtual Router becomes master due to a resume event."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3A00-0008" Virtual Router with cluster ID 1 state changed from master to backup
Description: Virtual Router state changed from master to backup
Format: Virtual Router with cluster ID %d state changed from master to backup
Variables: Virtual Router with cluster ID ${id} state changed from master to backup

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Event Monitoring" name="VR backup state" description="Virtual Router state changed from master to backup"

comment: Sample: msg_id="3A00-000A" Member 80B20002E5BCD Virtual Router with cluster ID 1 changed state to master due to 3 second notification gap from current master with IP 10.0.4.1
Description: Member Virtual Router changed state to master due to notification gap from current master
Format: Member %s Virtual Router with cluster ID %d changed state to master due to %d second notification gap from current master with IP %s
Variables: Member ${member} Virtual Router with cluster ID ${id} changed state to master due to ${value} second notification gap from current master with IP ${ip}

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Event Monitoring" name="VR notification gap" description="Member Virtual Router changed state to master due to notification gap from current master"

comment: Sample: msg_id="3A00-000B" Virtual Router with cluster ID 1 state changed to master
Description: Virtual Router state changed to master
Format: Virtual Router with cluster ID %d state changed to master
Variables: Virtual Router with cluster ID ${id} state changed to master

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Event Monitoring" name="VRRP master state" description="Virtual Router state changed to master"

comment: Sample: msg_id="3A00-000C" Initialization of Virtual Router Redundancy Protocol (VRRP) failed.

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Event Monitoring" name="VRRP initialization failed" description="Cluster VRRP initialization failed"

comment: Sample: msg_id="3800-0002" A DHCP server has attempted to assign an IP address to cluster member on the Cluster Interface. This log message recommends the admin isolate the Cluster interface network from the DHCP server, and specifies the interface number and IP address the cluster attempted to assign to the member.
Description: A DHCP server is interfering with static address assignment of cluster IP address 10.0.0.1 on eth0. Disable DHCP server access to eth5.
Format: A DHCP server is interfering with static address assignment of cluster IP address %s on eth%d. Disable DHCP server access to eth%d.
Variables: A DHCP server is interfering with static address assignment of cluster IP ${ip} on eth${port}. Please disable DHCP server access to eth${port}.

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Management" name="DHCP overwrite" description="A DHCP server is interfering with static address assignment of cluster IP address 10.0.0.1 on eth0. Disable DHCP server access to eth5."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3800-0003" Cluster interface link status changed to up.
Description: Cluster interface eth5 is up.

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Management" name="Cluster interface up" description="Cluster interface eth5 is up."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3800-0004" Cluster interface link status changed to down.
Description: Cluster interface eth5 is down.

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Management" name="Cluster interface down" description="Cluster interface eth5 is down."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3800-0264" The cluster master's attempt to synchronize time to a cluster member failed

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Management" name="Time synchronization failure" description="Cluster time synchronization failed."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3800-025C" Cluster member received an updated configuration from the master. The log message specifies the member serial number and configuration version number.
Description: Cluster member 80B20002E5BCD received updated configuration; version 3.
Format: Cluster member %s received updated configuration; version %d.
Variables: Cluster member ${member} received updated configuration; version ${version}.

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Management" name="Configuration update" description="Cluster member 80B20002E5BCD received updated configuration; version 3."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3B00-0001" The cluster communication channel between the specified members changed state.
Description: Cluster channel from member 80B20002E5BCD to master is up
Format: Cluster channel from member %s to master is %s.
Variables: Cluster channel from member ${member} to master is ${state}.

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Transport" name="Channel status change" description="Cluster channel from member 80B20002E5BCD to master is up"

comment: Sample: msg_id="3B00-0002" The specified Cluster interface is down.
Description: Cluster interface eth5 is down.

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Transport" name="Cluster interface down" description="Cluster interface eth5 is down."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3A00-000E" The Virtual Router representing the cluster is now enabled
Description: Virtual Router with cluster ID 1 is now enabled
Format: Virtual Router with cluster ID %d is now enabled
Variables: Virtual Router with cluster ID ${id} is now enabled

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Event Monitoring" name="VR enabled" description="Virtual Router with cluster ID 1 is now enabled"

comment: Sample: msg_id="3A00-000F" The Virtual Router representing the cluster is now disabled
Description: Virtual Router with cluster ID 1 is now disabled
Format: Virtual Router with cluster ID %d is now disabled
Variables: Virtual Router with cluster ID ${id} is now disabled

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Event Monitoring" name="VR disabled" description="Virtual Router with cluster ID 1 is now disabled"

comment: Sample: msg_id="3800-0278" The non-master member of the cluster will be reset to factory default-settings because FireCluster is disabled.
Description: Cluster disabled. Non-master member 80B20002E5BCD will be reset to factory-default settings.
Format: Cluster disabled. Non-master member %s will be reset to factory-default settings.
Variables: Cluster disabled. Non-master member %s will be reset to factory-default settings.

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Management" name="Cluster disabled" description="Cluster disabled. Non-master member 80B20002E5BCD will be reset to factory-default settings."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3800-0279" The non-master member of the cluster will be reset to factory-default settings due to a critical configuration change. A configuration change is critical if it would cause the master and backup master to lose the TCP connection on the cluster interface.
Description: Non-master member 80B20002E5BCD will be reset to factory-default settings due to a critical cluster configuration change.
Format: Non-master member %s will be reset to factory-default settings due to a critical cluster configuration change.
Variables: Non-master member ${member} will be reset to factory default-settings due to a critical cluster configuration change.

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Management" name="Critical configuration change" description="Non-master member 80B20002E5BCD will be reset to factory-default settings due to a critical cluster configuration change."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3800-0280" Cluster master 80B20002E5BCD was unable to issue a device discovery message.
Description: The cluster master was unable to issue a device discovery message.
Format: Cluster master %s was unable to issue a device discovery message.
Variables: Cluster master ${master} was unable to issue a device discovery message.

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Management" name="Device discovery failed" description="The cluster master was unable to issue a device discovery message."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3800-0282" Local member has FireCluster enabled and is ready to join.
Description: Member 80B20002E5BCD is ready to join the cluster.
Format: Member %s is ready to join the cluster.
Variables: Member ${member} is ready to join the cluster.

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Management" name="Member ready to join" description="Member 80B20002E5BCD is ready to join the cluster."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3800-025A" Cluster was enabled on the specified member.

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Management" name="Cluster enabled" description="Cluster enabled on member 80B20002E5BCD."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3800-025B" Cluster disabled on the cluster member while it was the cluster master.
Description: Cluster disabled on cluster master 80B20002E5BCD.
Format: Cluster disabled on cluster master %s.
Variables: Cluster disabled on cluster master ${master}.

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Management" name="Cluster disabled on master" description="Cluster disabled on cluster master 80B20002E5BCD."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3800-027A" The non-master member of the Cluster will be reset to factory-default settings because it was removed from the cluster.
Description: Non-master cluster member 80B20002E5BCD was removed from cluster, and will be reset to factory-default settings.
Format: Non-master cluster member %s was removed from cluster, and will be reset to factory-default settings.
Variables: "Non-master cluster member %s was removed from cluster, and will be reset to factory-default settings."

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Management" name="Non-master member removed" description="Non-master cluster member 80B20002E5BCD was removed from cluster, and will be reset to factory-default settings."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3800-027E" Failed to reset cluster member 80B20002E5BCD to factory-default settings.
Description: Failed to reset to factory-default settings.
Format: Failed to reset cluster member %s to factory-default settings.
Variables: Failed to reset member ${member} to factory-default settings.

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Management" name="Factory-default reset failed" description="Failed to reset to factory-default settings."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3900-0003" Master 80B20002E5BFE detected loss of heartbeat from member 80B20002E5BCD, cluster channel is up.
Description: The specified Cluster failed to receive a heartbeat message.
Format: Master %s detected loss of heartbeat from member %s, cluster channel is up.
Variables: "Master ${master} detected loss of heartbeat from member ${member}, cluster channel is up."

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Operations" name="Heartbeat lost" description="The specified Cluster failed to receive a heartbeat message."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3900-0005" The specified member has become master.

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Operations" name="Member promoted to master" description="Member 80B20002E5BCD is now master."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3900-0007" The master failed over to the specified member because that member has a higher health score than the master.
Description: Master 80B20002E5BCD failed over to member 80B20002E5BFE, which has a greater Weighted Average Index.
Format: Master %s failed over to member %s, which has a greater Weighted Average Index.
Variables: Master ${master} failover to member ${member} with greater Weighted Average Index.

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Operations" name="Failover due to WAI" description="Master 80B20002E5BCD failed over to member 80B20002E5BFE, which has a greater Weighted Average Index."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3900-0010" The cluster member changed to the specified role.
Description: Member 80B20002E5BCD changed role to master

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Operations" name="Member role change" description="Member 80B20002E5BCD changed role to master"

comment: Sample: msg_id="3900-0011" Specified monitored interface link status changed, which will change the health index for the member.
Description: Monitored interface eth0 link is down.

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Operations" name="Interface link status change" description="Monitored interface eth0 link is down."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3900-0012" Member 80B20002E5BCD took over as master from member 80B20002E5BFE.
Description: The specified member has taken over as master..
Format: Member %s took over as master from member %s.
Variables: Member ${member} took over as master from member ${member}.

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Operations" name="New master" description="The specified member has taken over as master.."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3900-0015" Master 80B20002E5BCD initiated failover by administrator request.
Description: The administrator has initiated a failover.
Format: Master %s initiated failover by administrator request.
Variables: Master ${master} initiated failover by administrator request..

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Operations" name="Failover initiated by administrator" description="The administrator has initiated a failover."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3900-0016" Cannot initiate failover from master 80B20002E5BCD to member 80B20002E5BFE due to higher Weighted Average Index on current master or backup master is unreachable.
Description: The failover requested by administrator cannot proceed because the master has a higher health index, or the backup master is unreachable.
Format: Cannot initiate failover from master %s to member %s due to higher Weighted Average Index on current master or backup master is unreachable.
Variables: Cannot initiate failover from master ${master} to member ${member} due to higher Weighted Average Index on current master or other member is unreachable.

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Operations" name="Cannot initiate failover" description="The failover requested by administrator cannot proceed because the master has a higher health index, or the backup master is unreachable."

comment: Name: Failover due to interface state change
Sample: msg_id="3900-0019" A cluster failover event occurred due to a change of interface state.
Description: Cluster failover due to interface eth4 link down event.
Format: Cluster failover due to interface %s link %s event.
Variables: Cluster failover due to interface ${ifname} link ${state} event.

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Operations" name="Failover due to interface state change" description="Cluster failover due to interface eth4 link down event."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3900-0058" Cluster member 80B20002E5BCD changed role from idle to backup master
Description: The role of the specified Cluster member changed.
Format: Cluster member %s changed role from %s to %s.
Variables: Cluster member ${member} changed role from ${role} to ${role}.

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Operations" name="Member Role Change" description="The role of the specified Cluster member changed."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3900-000C" Full state synchronization from the master to the specified member failed. Member state will not change to Backup Master.
Description: Full state synchronization from master 80B20002E5BCD to backup master 80B20002E5BFE failed.
Format: Full state synchronization from master %s to backup master %s failed.
Variables: Full state synchronization from master ${master} to backup master ${member} failed.

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Operations" name="Synchronization failed" description="Full state synchronization from master 80B20002E5BCD to backup master 80B20002E5BFE failed."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3900-000D" Full state synchronization from the master to the specified member timed out. Member state will not change to Backup Master.
Description: Full state synchronization from master 80B20002E5BCD to backup master 80B20002E5BFE timed out.
Format: Full state synchronization from master %s to backup master %s timed out.
Variables: Full state synchronization from master ${master} to backup master ${member} timed out.

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Operations" name="Synchronization timeout" description="Full state synchronization from master 80B20002E5BCD to backup master 80B20002E5BFE timed out."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3900-000E" Full state synchronization from master 80B20002E5BCD to backup master 80B20002E5BFE completed successfully.
Description: Full state synchronization to the specified member was successful. Member status changed to backup master.
Format: Full state synchronization from master %s to backup master %s completed successfully.
Variables: Full state synchronization from master ${master} to backup master ${member} completed successfully

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Operations" name="Synchronization successful" description="Full state synchronization to the specified member was successful. Member status changed to backup master."

comment: Sample: msg_id="3900-000F" Cluster failover due to a link failure on the current master, which now has a health index lower than the backup master. The log message specifies which interface has the link down.
Description: Master 80B20002E5BCD failed-over to member 80B20002E5BFE due to a link-down event on interface eth3.
Format: Master %s failed-over to member %s due to a link-down event on interface %s.
Variables: Master ${master} failed-over to member ${member} due to a link-down event on interface ${ifname}.

update.message: $MESSAGE NEOMeta: area="Cluster / Operations" name="Failover due to link-down" description="Master 80B20002E5BCD failed-over to member 80B20002E5BFE due to a link-down event on interface eth3."
